title: EGA protocol metadata schema
description: Metadata schema used by the European Genome-phenome Archive (EGA) to validate its protocol metadata object. A protocol is an information entity of a set of instructions that describe an how a procedure, analysis or experiment is done. Comprises metadata (e.g. Type of protocol) of a plan specification, with sufficient level of detail and quantitative information to communicate it (and thus reproduce it) between investigation agents (i.e. researchers). Further details can be found in the EGA-metadata-schema GitHub repository (https://github.com/EbiEga/ega-metadata-schema/tree/main/schemas) and EGA-archive website (https://ega-archive.org/)

objectId.title: Object's IDs block
objectId.description: Node containing the main identifiers of the object (e.g. alias, centerName...), inherited from the common definitions.

allOf.title: Check that protocol EGA ID (EGAO) is correct

schemaDescriptor.title: Schema descriptor node
schemaDescriptor.description: Inherited schema descriptor node containing metadata about the schemas and standards used to create the JSON document itself.

objectTitle.title: Name of the protocol
objectTitle.description: Name of the protocol (e.g. 'myProtocol-13'). To be defined by the user.

protocolTypeDescriptor.title: Protocol type descriptor
protocolTypeDescriptor.description: Node to contain the information about the type and subtype of the protocol. References to ontologies allow for a clear provenance and documentation of the protocol type.

protocolType.title: Type of protocol
protocolType.description: Classification by type of the protocol (e.g. 'Sample collection'), to be chosen from a controlled vocabulary (CV) list. If you cannot find your term in the CV list, please create an issue at our [metadata GitHub repository](https://github.com/EbiEga/ega-metadata-schema/issues/new/choose) proposing its addition.

protocolSubtype.title: Subtype of the protocol
protocolSubtype.description: Ontology term of the protocol subtype. Search for yours at the [Ontology Lookup Service (OLS)](https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/index). This allows for a specific designation of the protocol within the high level 'protocolType' field. For instance, for Treatment's subtype 'clinical treatment' ('termLabel') we would use 'EFO:0003814' ('termId'). In case the protocol does not have a subtype, use 'NCIT:C48660' for 'Not applicable'.

allOf.title: Inherited ontologyTerm structure of termId and termLabel

termId.title: Ontology constraints for this specific termId

meta:enum.NCIT:C48660: Not applicable: Determination of a subtype is not relevant for this protocol.

protocolDescription.title: Description of the protocol
protocolDescription.description: Description of the protocol (e.g. 'First tilt the cell culture flask... ...and finally let it still for 2 hours.'), being descriptive enough to be replicated between institutions or performers.
examples: First tilt the cell culture flask... ...and finally let it still for 2 hours.
Patients were given a ketogenic diet for 3 weeks at intervals consisting in...

protocolPerformers.title: Protocol performers array
protocolPerformers.description: Array of performers' descriptions of those individuals, groups, or institutions that executed the protocol.

items.title: Performer of the protocol
items.description: Free form text to specify the institution, group, or individuals that performed the protocol.

protocolInstruments.title: Protocol instrument array
protocolInstruments.description: Array of instruments used in the protocol. It is not indispensable to provide each and every piece of instruments used, but a set of the ones you would highlight in your protocol for other researchers to know, since it will help them discover your data.

items.title: Instrument used in the protocol
items.description: Free form text to specify the device, which provides a mechanical or electronic function, and was used by the performer of the protocol. We highly recommend the usage of ontologized terms (e.g. 'Oligonucleotide synthesizer') from the [Experimental Factor Ontology (EFO)](http://www.ebi.ac.uk/efo/EFO_0000548) along their CURIEs between square brackets (e.g. '[OBI:0400113]').

protocolSoftware.title: Protocol software array
protocolSoftware.description: Array of software descriptions used in the protocol. It is not indispensable to provide each and every piece of software used, but a set of the ones you would highlight in your protocol for other researchers to know, since it will help them discover your data.

items.title: Software descriptions used in the protocol
items.description: Free form text to specify the programs and other operating information (including bespoken scripts) used by a computer that were used by the performer of the protocol. We highly recommend the usage of ontologized terms (e.g. 'SAMtools') from the [Software Ontology (SWO)](https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/swo) along their versions (e.g. 'v3.0.1'), if applicable, and CURIEs between square brackets (e.g. '[SWO:1100143]').

protocolRelationships.title: Protocol relationships
protocolRelationships.description: Comprises metadata (e.g. Source or Target) of a directional association between two entities. This relationships node contains all the possible relationships between metadata objects, both outside of (e.g. an Array Design Format that was submitted to ArrayExpress being linked to their microarray data within EGA) and within (e.g. a protocol being linked to an experiment) the EGA.

allOf.title: Relationship constraints for a protocol
allOf.description: Not all possible relationships between objects are allowed (e.g. an individual should not be linked to a policy). This node contains the restricted relationships that can be given for a protocol.

anyOf.title: Allowed relationships of type referencedBy (main ones)

Relationships of external accessions and URLs (optional ones)
anyOf.description: Almost any relationship is imaginable with external accessions and URLs.

contains.title: Constraint to have at least one 'submission' relationship

protocolAttributes.title: Protocol custom attributes
protocolAttributes.description: Custom attributes of a protocol: reusable attributes to encode tag-value pairs (e.g. Tag being 'step index' and its Value '2') with optional units. Its properties are inherited from the common-definitions.json schema.
